title: Citi's China Expansion Continues, Opens Branch in Changsha
summary: Changsha – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today officially opened for business in the city of Changsha. The branch is Citi's 12th in China and is the first for Citi in China's central region. To mark the milestone, Citi held a ceremony attended by Stephen Bird, Chief Executive Officer for Citi Asia Pacific; Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer for Citi China; and Simon Chow, Country Business Manager of Citibank China, as well as local government and regulatory representatives.
tag-1: Citi's China Expansion Continues, Opens Branch in Changsha
tag-3: Changsha – Citibank (China) Co., Ltd. ("Citi China") today officially opened for business in the city of Changsha. The branch is Citi's 12th in China and is the first for Citi in China's central region. To mark the milestone, Citi held a ceremony attended by Stephen Bird, Chief Executive Officer for Citi Asia Pacific; Andrew Au, Chief Executive Officer for Citi China; and Simon Chow, Country Business Manager of Citibank China, as well as local government and regulatory representatives.
tag-4: Mr. Stephen Bird said, "In 2011, Citi is enjoying strong growth momentum in China, reflecting our client focus, our leadership in innovation and our ability to use our global network to best advantage on behalf of our clients. We are widening our product set in China, and at the same time we are expanding our network to dynamic cities, such as Changsha. China remains a priority market for Citi, and we will continue to invest in China in 2011 and beyond."
tag-5: Mr. Andrew Au said, "Hunan province is a key driver of economic development in central China, and Citi is delighted to be establishing a presence in its capital, Changsha. We are putting an outstanding team on the ground in Changsha and expect that our new branch will play an active role in supporting both retail and institutional clients in and around the city."
tag-6: The Changsha branch offers a range of Renminbi (RMB) and foreign-currency products and services to multinational and local companies, Chinese residents and foreign nationals. Citi China has a large and diverse base of institutional clients and has a demonstrated track record in helping Chinese companies achieve their strategic goals.
tag-7: Bankers at the branch will work closely with leading companies in Changsha, including small-and-medium enterprises, large local corporations, and multinational companies. Corporate banking services offered at the branch include cash management, trade finance and services, loans and syndication, FX transactions, project finance and structured finance and other financial products.
tag-8: Citi is the first international bank to offer consumer banking services in Changsha. Like all other Citibank outlets in China, the new outlet offers both Citibanking and Citigold services.
tag-9: Mr. Simon Chow said, "Citibank has built a track record of delivering innovations in China that are distinguishing our service offering and adding value to our customers. The smart banking outlet we are opening in Changsha will give its residents a brand new and superior banking and wealth management experience."

tag-11: Citi also announced a number of initiatives designed to support the local community in and around Changsha. These include a new scholarship program with Hunan University to recognize 12 outstanding students comprising a mix of undergraduate and postgraduate students from the College of Finance and Statistics each year.
tag-12: Citi also announced its support for The Library Project, an NGO that donates libraries to under financed schools and orphanages in China. With Citi's support, The Library Project will establish five new reading rooms, which are designed to be fun and safe places for children to enjoy reading at rural elementary schools. Planning is currently centered upon establishing the rooms at five elementary schools in Anhua County, around four hours from Changsha.
tag-13: The Changsha branch houses 12 corporate bankers and 43 retail banking professionals. It is located at No.110, Furong Middle Road, 2nd Section, Changsha, Hunan Province, P. R. China.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Additional information may be found at www.citigroup.com.
tag-15: Citi China  Citi first established an office in China on May 15, 1902, in Shanghai. In April 2007, Citi was among the first international banks to locally incorporate in China. Citi's locally incorporated entity is known as Citibank (China) Co Ltd, which is wholly owned by Citibank N.A. Today Citi is a leading international bank in China, and has twelve corporate bank branches - in Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Tianjin, Chengdu, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chongqing, Guiyang, Nanjing and Changsha - and thirty-seven consumer bank outlets. With operations in more than 160 countries around the world, Citi is the most global of all international banks in China.
